idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Define notes in the key of G major
G4, B4, D5 = 67, 71, 74
D4, Fs4, A4 = 62, 66, 69
C4, E4 = 60, 64

# Define an eighth note rhythm function
def eighth(pattern):
    for note in pattern:
        if note == "rest":
            rest(0.5)  # Rest for half a beat
        else:
            playNote(note, beats=0.5)  # Play each note for half a beat

# Define the intro chord progression as a function
def intro_progression():
    playNote([G4, B4, D5], beats=2)  # G major
    playNote([D4, Fs4, A4], beats=2) # D major
    playNote([C4, E4, G4], beats=2)  # C major
    playNote([D4, Fs4, A4], beats=2) # D major

# Play the intro progression
intro_progression()

# Add a simple melody using the eighth function
eighth([G4, B4, D5, "rest", E4, D4, B4])

# Define a longer melody using the eighth function
def extended_melody():
    eighth([G4, B4, D5, "rest", E4, D4, B4, G4, B4, E4])  # First phrase
    eighth([D4, "rest", G4, A4, B4, D5, E4, G4, B4, D4])  # Second phrase
    eighth([E4, "rest", D5, C4, B4, A4, G4, "rest", B4, D5])  # Third phrase
    eighth([G4, A4, B4, D5, E4, "rest", D4, B4, G4])  # Fourth phrase, ending

# Play the extended melody after the intro
extended_melody()

# Define notes in the key of G major for organ part
G3, B3, D4 = 55, 59, 62
D3, Fs3, A3 = 50, 54, 57
C3, E3 = 48, 52

# Define an organ rhythm function
def organ_rhythm(pattern):
    for note in pattern:
        if note == "rest":
            rest(1)
        else:
            play(note, beats=1)

# Define the organ accompaniment chords
def organ_accompaniment():
    playNote([G3, B3, D4], beats=2)  # G major chord
    playNote([D3, Fs3, A3], beats=2) # D major chord
    playNote([C3, E3, G3], beats=2)  # C major chord
    playNote([D3, Fs3, A3], beats=2) # D major chord
# Play the organ accompaniment
organ_accompaniment()

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Define notes in the key of G major
G4, B4, D5 = 67, 71, 74
D4, Fs4, A4 = 62, 66, 69
C4, E4, A4 = 60, 64, 69

# Define an eighth note rhythm function
def eighth(pattern):
    for note in pattern:
        if note == "rest":
            rest(0.5)  # Rest for half a beat
        else:
            playNote(note, beats=0.5)  # Play each note for half a beat

# Define the intro chord progression as a function
def intro_progression():
    playNote([G4, B4, D5], beats=2)  # G major
    playNote([D4, Fs4, A4], beats=2) # D major
    playNote([C4, E4, G4], beats=2)  # C major
    playNote([D4, Fs4, A4], beats=2) # D major

# Play the intro progression
intro_progression()

# Add a simple melody using the eighth function
eighth([G4, B4, D5, "rest", E4, D4, B4])

# Define a longer melody at the end of the intro
def longer_melody():
    eighth([G4, A4, B4, "rest", B4, D5, E4, G4])  # First phrase
    eighth(["rest", B4, G4, E4, D4, B4, A4, G4])  # Second phrase
    eighth([G4, E4, "rest", D5, C4, B4, A4])      # Third phrase

# Play the longer melody after the intro progression
longer_melody()

# New TunePad cell
# Set instrument to guitar for a complementary melody

# Define notes in the key of G major for the guitar part
G3, B3, D4 = 55, 59, 62
A3, E4 = 57, 64
Fs3, C4 = 54, 60

# Define the guitar melody directly
def guitar_melody():
    # First phrase
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(B3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D4, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(B3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    
    # Second phrase
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)
    playNote(A3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(B3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(D4, beats=0.5)
    
    # Third phrase
    playNote(Fs3, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)
    playNote(E4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(C4, beats=0.5)
    playNote(B3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(A3, beats=0.5)
    playNote(G3, beats=0.5)
    rest(0.5)

# Play the guitar melody
guitar_melody()

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# New TunePad cell
# Set the instrument to strings for a gentle accompaniment


# Define notes in the key of G major for the string part
G3, B3, D4 = 55, 59, 62
A3, C4, E4 = 57, 60, 64

# Define a simple string melody to harmonize with other parts
def string_melody():
    playNote(G3, beats=1)  # Start on the root note
    playNote(B3, beats=1)  # Move to a harmony note
    playNote(D4, beats=2)  # Hold for longer on the chord note
    rest(1)            # Rest for a beat for breathing room

    playNote(A3, beats=1)  # Continue with a new chord
    playNote(C4, beats=1)  # Add harmony
    playNote(E4, beats=2)  # Hold this note longer
    rest(1)            # Rest again to keep it gentle

    playNote(G3, beats=1)  # Return to root note
    playNote(B3, beats=1)  # Repeat the harmony
    playNote(D4, beats=2)  # Hold for a sustained effect
    rest(1)            # Rest to match with other phrases

# Play the string melody
string_melody()

name: Anxiety Track
summary: A mind track for when you are feeling anxious and are in a state of mind that is hard to get out of. The calming nature of this track seeks to settle and comfort individuals through hard times
